titles.title: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives regarding Tunisia's peaceful Jasmine Revolution.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Middle East and South Asia .

term.name: Rule of law and government transparency
Sovereignty, recognition, national governance and status

bill.summary: 1/25/2012--Introduced. Congratulates the people of Tunisia for holding the first multi-party democratic elections since the outbreak of popular revolutions throughout the Middle East and North Africa in 2011. Commends the Tunisian independent electoral commission for conducting a free and credible election. Affirms the U.S. national interest in a transition to democracy and economic prosperity in Tunisia. Urges increased U.S. engagement with the Tunisian government and people. Reaffirms the friendship between the people of the United States and the people of Tunisia.
